memory_management.RAII: Resource Acquisition Is Initialization. Use smart pointers (std::unique_ptr, std::shared_ptr).
memory_management.RuleOfThree: If you define a destructor, copy constructor, or copy assignment operator, you probably need all three.
memory_management.RuleOfFive: In C++11, add move constructor and move assignment operator.

performance.Inlining: Use 'inline' for small, frequently called functions.
performance.PassByReference: Pass large objects by const reference to avoid copying.
performance.VectorReserve: Use std::vector::reserve() to avoid multiple reallocations.

templates.SFINAE: Substitution Failure Is Not An Error. Used for template metaprogramming.
templates.Concepts: C++20 feature to constrain template arguments.
